alert.note: Alert for Lunenburg; Mecklenburg (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 5:34PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Mecklenburg and southwestern Lunenburg Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 533 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clarksville, or 8 miles southeast of Redoak, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Chase City around 605 PM EDT. Boydton around 610 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Nelson, Wilburn, Spanish Grove, Beechwood, John H Kerr Dam, North View, Finchley, Finneywood, Skipwith and Fairview. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
